HelpXML.Title: cdsplot
HelpXML.Purpose: cdsplot produces the candlestick plot for robust model selection in linear regression

Item.Name: outms

ItemCell.Description: r x 4 matrix containing information about 'influential units' or empty matrix. Influential units in this context are defined as the units which enter the subset in the final part of the search and bring the value of the Cp below the minimum or above the maximum value of the central part of the search. 1st col: x coordinates; 2nd col: y coordinates; 3rd col: step of entry into subset; 4nd col: unit number. If matrix outl contains more columns they are ignored.

vector of length 2 containing information about n (number of units of the sample and bigP, number of explanatory variables, including the constant, in the full model). This information is necessary to compute the envelopes.

Item.Name: CandleWidth
Item.LongDesc: Scalar defining the width of the boxes which represent central part of the candles. The default width is 0.05.

Item.Name: color
Item.LongDesc: Three elements color vector, [R G B], or a string specifying the color name. MATLAB supplies a default color if none is specified or if it is empty. The default color differs depending on the background color of the figure window. See COLORSPEC in the MATLAB Reference Guide for color names.

Item.Name: LineWidth
Item.LongDesc: Line Width (in points) for the vertical lines outside the boxes of the candles. The default LineWidth is 0.5 points.

Item.Name: ylimy
Item.LongDesc: Vector with two elements controlling minimum and maximum on the y axis. Default value is [-2 50] (automatic scale).

Item.Name: xlimx
Item.LongDesc: Vector with two elements controlling minimum and maximum on the x axis. Default value is '' (automatic scale).

Item.Name: label
Item.LongDesc: Cell array of strings of length k (number of rows of matrix stat) containing the labels of the selected models. Default value is '' that is no label is plotted on the screen.

Item.Name: quant
Item.LongDesc: Vector containing quantiles for the horizontal lines associated witht the confidence bands of Cp. The default is to plot 2.5% and 97.5% envelopes. In other words the default is quant=[0.025;0.975].

Item.Name: lablast
Item.ShortDesc: Label for the last unit entered
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which specifies whether to add the label of the unit which enters the final step of the search close to its symbol. If lablast=1 label is added else (default) no label is added.

Item.Name: laboutl
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which specifies whether to add the labels of the 'influential units' if laboutl=1 the unit number is added close to its symbol. if laboutl=2 the unit number together with the entry step is added close to its symbol else (default) no label is added.

Item.Name: labbold
Item.LongDesc: Cell array of strings which specifies the models which have to be highlighted (the linewidth of the vertical lines outside the boxes of the models specified in labbold is considerably increased). As default labbold=''.

Item.Name: labenv
Item.LongDesc: If labelv=1 labels of the quantiles used to generate the horizontal lines associated with the envelopes are added, else if labelv=0 (default) no label is added.

Item.Name: barend
Item.LongDesc: Scalar which specifies whether to add small horizontal lines at the end of the vertical lines representing the whiskers. If barend=1 horizontal lines are added else (default) no additional line is drawn.

Item.Name: cpbrush
Item.LongDesc: If cpbrush is an empty value (default), no brushing is done. The activation of this option (cpbrush is a scalar) enables the user to select a set of candles in the candlestick plot and to monitor the corresponding forward searches in a new plot. If cpbrush is not an empty value the user has to supply the matrix which in the first column contains the fwd search index and in the other k columns the values of Cp associated with the k models displayed in the candlestick plot.

References.Item: Riani and Atkinson (2010), Robust model selection with flexible trimming, Computational Statistics and Data Analysis (in press).
